intro: Monochasma japonicum, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to East Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and ability to bloom in late summer.
